New Records: Ishan Kishan registered a career-best 89 runs.
Key Match Events: India beat Sri Lanka by 62 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the series.
Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan added 111 runs in 11.5 overs.
Sri Lanka kept losing wickets at regular intervals during their chase.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanka won the toss and decided to bowl first.
India made six changes with Deepak Hooda given his T20I debut.
Sri Lanka made two changes with Dinesh Chandimal and Jeffrey Vandersay replacing Maheesh Theekshana and Kusal Mendis.
India are yet to be beaten in T20Is under Rohit Sharma's full-time captaincy.
The series offers a chance for players like Sanju Samson, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Shreyas Iyer, Ishan Kishan, and Avesh Khan to present their skills ahead of the T20 World Cup.
Sri Lanka are without Wanindu Hasaranga due to Covid-19 infection.
Sri Lanka might employ left-arm spinner Praveen Jayawickrama and leg-spinner Jefferey Vandersay to exploit the spin problem of the Indian batters.
Sri Lanka's top-order struggles were highlighted as a concern by Dasun Shanaka in the pre-series press conference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow.
India posted a huge 199/2 after being asked to bat first.
